title.narrative: Provision of essential shelter and NFI assistance in hard-to-reach areas of Kunduz, Faryab and Jawzjan provinces

description.narrative:
In line with the Common Humanitarian Fund’s (CHF) 1st standard allocation strategy for 2018, this project will reach at least 845 households, representing an estimated 5,915 beneficiaries across hard-to-reach and underserved districts of Faryab (Almar, Kohistan, Khoja Sabz Posh, Pashtunkot, Qaisar, Shirintagab, Dawlatabad, Bilcherag), Kunduz (Qala-i-Zal, Dashti-Archi, Chahardara, Aliabad, Khanabad) and Jawzjan provinces (Darzab, Qushtepa).
In light of needs assessed by ACTED in these three target provinces, as well as of the current priorities identified by the Emergency Shelter and Non-Food Items (ESNFI) Cluster, ACTED has designed a two-pronged intervention composed by the provision of emergency Cluster-approved NFI assistance to 420 households, particularly focusing on areas that cannot be covered by other humanitarian agencies and by the provision of cash for shelter upgrades amounting to 425 households that will receive a maximum of USD 300 each, as per current Cluster standards.
ACTED’s NFI assistance (Output 1) will primarily aim to respond to rapid onset emergencies that will arise in the next few weeks and months across target provinces due to conflict or natural disasters, and will particularly focus on those areas where NFI assistance is found to be necessary and where no other partner can provide assistance due to lack of access or resources. The cash for shelters’ upgrades component (Output 2) will target vulnerable households whose shelter is in a poor condition, leaving them exposed to seasonal weather fluctuations that endanger their health and wellbeing, in identified districts that are currently underserved. This intervention is informed by ACTED’s knowledge and strong access in target districts, as well as by the rapid shelter needs assessment that was conducted by ACTED’s Appraisal, Monitoring and Evaluation Unit (AMEU) in December 2017 (see Annex 1).
These two types of responses will encompass strong protection mainstreaming elements. ACTED will notably ensure that all beneficiaries are sensitized on their rights and sources of assistance available in their area of residence or displacement. ACTED will also endeavour to refer households requiring specialized protection assistance to local protection stakeholders, particularly the United Nation’s High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR).
